subject: Re: Mike's Box 12.470 Proto 1
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Mike, I have one more question for clarification.  

I listened to the various voice recordings you captured and do I 
understand correctly that the little portable-enclosed system 
(pictured on your blog) captured the audio we've heard from you to 
date?

Thanks.

LC Duplatt
http://www.AngelsGhosts.com

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" 
<michaelcoletta@...> wrote:
>
> Hi LC,
> 
> The two setups I did were:
> 
> 1) Three 12-469's through a mixer, mixed with white noise 
(performed 
> with Audacity), my voice via a microphone, and all that audio 
> captured using a free program called "Scanner Recorder". You can 
> download it here: http://www.davee.com/scanrec/
> I have not really taken that unit anywhere to test it properly.  I 
> only did the original testing you hear on the video.
> 
> 2) One 12-470 placed in a "chamber", with a noise generator (used 
> a "My Lil' Reminder" 20 second digital recorder/player) with 
recorded 
> white/pink noise I captured while in Florida.  Also inside is 
> a "Listen Up" amplified microphone and an Olympus digital recorder.
> The only wiring is a Y-connector which connects the output from the 
> amplified mic to the input of the recorder, and also to ear-buds 
for 
> listening to what is being recorded. You can also plug a small 
> speaker into this if desired.
> The raw audio from the linear sweep of either the AM or FM band is 
> projected from the 12-470 speaker, into the closed "chamber", along 
> with the audio from the speaker of the noise generator ("My Lil' 
> Reminder") unit.  Those two sources, plus any ambient noise inside 
> the "chamber" is picked up by the amplified mic and fed into the 
> recorder and ear-buds. The recorder produces the .wav file.
> You can use a 12-469 instead of the 12-470. You just need to 
connect 
> a small speker to the output of the 12-469.
> 
> As with my three 12-469 system, I have so far only done the initial 
> test run on th 12-470 system.  I hope to bring both units to a 
place 
> where I can do some better experimentation.  I have 2 weeks off 
near 
> Christmas time, so that is probably when I'll be doing that.
> 
> I hope I have answered your questions, LC.
> 
> - Mike
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wrote:
> >
> > Mike,
> > 
> > Today I modified my Radio Shack 12-469, but have some questions.  
> It 
> > was easy to do, and I instantly plugged it into my Olympus voice 
> > recorder and recorded off of it easily.  Now I want to pipe some 
> > white noise in (and ambient), as well. 
> > 
> > 1) Is the set-up in your video what has worked best for you (with 
> the 
> > computer and all)?
> > 2) Will you tell us what free computer programs you used (I think 
> one 
> > is Audacity)?
> > 3) What microphone and white noise generator did you use for your 
> > travel pack unit pictured on UFOGeek.com (posted on December 
8th)?  
> > And can you give me a layout for the wiring of it - you know, how 
> it 
> > all hooks together?  I'll figure it out sooner or later, but I'd 
> > rather it be sooner!
> > 
> > Thanks, LC
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In EVP-ITC@...m, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" 
> > <michaelcoletta@> wrote:
> > >
> > > I am currently putting together another video, just like my 
> others 
> > > showing a very practical way to use the Radio Shack Hack 
devices.
> > > You probably saw my 12-469 practical use videos, now I'm going 
to 
> > be 
> > > sharing a 12-470 practical use video.  This one is of a totally 
> > > portable system that uses a noise generator, the hacked 12-470, 
a 
> > > digital (or analog) recorder, and a microphone which gathers 
the 
> > raw 
> > > audio sweep, white noise (or in my case a special white/pink 
> noise 
> > file 
> > > I created), and any ambient noise within a chamber.. and places 
> > that 
> > > session int a .wav file.  It also includes an ear piece so you 
> can 
> > > hear, real time, what the digital recorder is recording (the 
> mixer 
> > of 
> > > the session sound within the chamber).
> > > Stay tuned for that video later today....
> > > 
> > > - Mike
> > > All my Radio Shack Hack videos can be found at
> > > http://www.ufogeek.com
> > >
> >
>
